TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ProjectCollection extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates a set of related projects, their toolsets, a default set of global properties, and the loggers that should be used to build them. A global version of this class acts as the default project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Multiple project collections can exist within an app domain. However, these must not build concurrently.

Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with no global properties or loggers. The project collection toolset is initialized from the configuration file and registry.

MemberSignature.Usage: new Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection (globalProperties, loggers, remoteLoggers, toolsetDefinitionLocations, maxNodeCount, onlyLogCriticalEvents)

Docs.param: The default global properties to use. May be null.
The loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
Any remote loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
The locations from which to load toolsets.
The maximum number of nodes to use for building.
If set to true, only critical events will be logged.
Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with specified global properties, loggers, node count, and onlyLogCriticalEvents value. The project collection toolset is initialized from toolsets in the given locations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Throws InvalidProjectFileException if any of the global properties are reserved.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DefaultToolsVersion { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DefaultToolsVersion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets the default tools version of this project collection.
Docs.value: The default tools version of this project collection, which is always defined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This default value is obtained from the .exe.config file, from the system registry, or if neither is present, from the hard-coded tools version "2.0".
The set method throws InvalidOperationException if a toolset with the provided tools version has not been defined.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that determines whether is temporarily disabled on projects in this collection. This allows, for example, a global properties to be set without projects getting marked dirty for reevaluation as a consequence.
Docs.value: Returns a flag that determines whether is temporarily disabled.

Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection.

abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject() before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope."

Protected Overridable Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

Docs.param: If true, releases both managed and unmanaged resources; otherwise releases only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection. Shuts down any logging services that the project collection owns and releases the logger thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Follows the garbage disposal guidelines of .NET.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Escape(string unescapedString) cil managed
Public Shared Function Escape (unescapedString As String) As String

Docs.param: The string to be converted.
Docs.summary: Converts special characters in a string to MSBuild escape format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, "%3b" for ";". Only characters that are especially significant to MSBuild parsing are converted. Callers can use this method to make a string safe to be parsed by other methods that would otherwise expand it. Callers can also use this method to make a string safe to be written to a project file.

Docs.param: The path to a project file to be matched.
Docs.summary: Gets all projects whose project path matches the given path.
Docs.returns: All projects whose project path matches the given path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There may be more than one project with the given path because projects are also distinguished by global properties and/or tools version.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property GlobalProjectCollection As ProjectCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the global project collection object.
Docs.value: The global project collection object. This is a singleton project collection with no global properties or loggers. Toolset information is obtained from the configuration file and registry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Thread safe.

Docs.value: The read-only default global properties for all projects in this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.SetGlobalProperty%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.RemoveGlobalProperty%2A> to add, set, and remove global properties.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the targets and tasks of projects in the project collection can be built.
Docs.value: if the targets and tasks of projects in this project collection can be built; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used for security purposes. By default, a new project has the same IsBuildEnabled setting as the parent project collection that contains it. When IsBuildEnabled is false, the Build method on this project fails.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LoadedProjects As ICollection(Of Project)

Docs.summary: Gets all the projects currently loaded into this collection.
Docs.value: All the projects currently loaded into this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each project has a unique combination of path, global properties, and tools version.

Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code in the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(string fileName) cil managed
Public Function LoadProject (fileName As String) As Project

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The project file to evaluate.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code in the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.
Docs.returns: If an existing project in the collection has already been evaluated from the given project file, the existing project is returned. Otherwise, a new project is created, evaluated, added to the project collection, and returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project source code from.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given XML reader. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to this project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to a project file.
In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject (string fileName, string toolsVersion);

Docs.param: The project file to evaluate.
The tools version to use. May be null.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties of this project collection and the given tools version.
Docs.returns: If an existing project in the collection has already been evaluated from the given project file, and with the given tools version, then the existing project is returned. Otherwise, a new project is created, evaluated, added to the project collection, and returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is NOT raised for changes to global properties, or any other change that doesn't actually dirty the XML.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value the indicates whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled on projects in this collection. This is useful when the host expects to make a number of reads and writes to projects, and wants to temporarily sacrifice correctness for performance.
Docs.value: A flag that determines whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement projectRootElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The project root element to unload.
Docs.summary: Removes a project root element from the project root cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is useful for the case where the host knows that all projects using this root element have been removed, and that any unsaved changes should be discarded.

Docs.exception: Thrown if the project root element to unload is still in use by a loaded project or its imports.

Docs.param: The project to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the given project from the project collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The host should call this method when it no longer needs the project.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the given project is not present in the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Version As Version
public: static property Version ^ Version { Version ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the file version of the assembly file that contains the MSBuild engine.
Docs.value: The file version of the assembly file that contains the MSBuild engine.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the Windows file version (specifically the value of the ProductVersion resource), which is not necessarily the assembly version. To obtain the assembly version, use Constants.AssemblyVersion.
